results.title: Introduction to jazz
results.creator_credit: University of California, Los Angeles. Dept. of Theater Arts and Denis Sanders
results.brief_description: A survey of the development of jazz in the United States from the time of its primnitive African source, through the wistful rhythms of the enslaved negroes of the South to the sophisticated jazz of modern times. The film features Freddy Leadbelly in the work-song “Take this hammer”, Louis Armstrong and his Hot Five, and the Red Hot Peppers in such numbers as “West end blues”, “Shoe shine drag” and “Jelly roll”. Narrated by Frank Wolff.

results.title: Introduction to horizontal jumping: long jump - triple jump
results.creator_credit: Department of Education, Queensland and Ron Taylor
results.brief_description: Provides an introduction to horizontal jumping. Shows flexibility and warm-up exercises and gives comprehensive information on run-up, take-off, flight and landing techniques.

results.title: Introduction to holography
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and Thomas Smith
results.brief_description: Holography is a recently discovered new means of recording images on photographic film. The technique was first conceived by Dennis Gabor in the late 1940’s. This film illustrates the basic principles of holography and some of the many optical effects possible with holography. Also considered is the value of holography as both a scientific tool and an artistic medium.

results.title: Introduction to gesture drawing
results.brief_description: Gesture drawing is a technique that allows the artist to concentrate on movement, where details are often eliminated. The rhythm and flow of various kinds of movement and the appearance of movement in static objects are shown and then drawn in the gesture technique. The practice of gesture drawing promotes a freedom of expression that will enhance other, more finished kinds of artwork. Includes drawings by Rembrandt, Daumier, Dufy.

results.title: Introduction to foreign trade
results.creator_credit: Coronet Instructional Films and David A. Smart
results.brief_description: First establishes the importance of foreign trade to the economy and then presents a general picture of the mechanics of international commerce. The role of monetary standards and control, national policies in reference to those controls, distribution of raw materials and markets are shown. Then, in an actual exchange of goods, the detailed domestic and foreign operations involved in the sale, shipment and payment are protrayed.

results.title: Introduction to drawing materials
results.brief_description: Drawing materials and tools, such as pencils, pen and ink, tempera, watercolor, felt-tip pens and oil pastels have different qualities that can be discovered through experiment. Chalk goes on quickly and easily creating soft, muted effects; brilliantly colored crayons can make a line hard and sharp or soft and blurry. Shows drawings by Degas, Leonardo da Vinci, Cezanne, Van Gogh.

results.title: Introduction to Denmark
results.creator_credit: Laterna Film and Danish Government Film Office
results.brief_description: The basic characteristics and major occupations of the people of a complex modern welfare state. The streets of Copenhagen; its people; the production of food; shipyards launching fishing boats; industries, factory mass production and handcraftsmanship; aspects of culture and recreation, all give revealing insights into this progressive and picturesque country.

results.title: Introduction to Crefal
results.brief_description: A picture of the land and people around Lake Patzcuaro, Mexico, site of the international fundamental education training and production centre for Latin America. At the Crefal Centre and in collaboration with UNESCO workers, training is given to village people to assist with maintaining traditional skills of fishing, farming and weaving.

results.title: Introduction to control
results.creator_credit: AEI Film Unit, Michael Clarke and Brian Kaufman
results.brief_description: Defines and illustrates the principles of industrial process control. Mechanical and automatic feedback control systems are compared and the film shows how automatic electronic control can be refined to handle a wide range of applications from huge and complex plant to the milling of a precision curve involving accuracies of 1/10,000th of an inch.

results.title: Introduction to Confucius
results.creator_credit: Mass Communications, International Film Foundation and Sumner J. Glimcher
results.brief_description: This film deals with the main tenets of Confucian thought which are clearly presented. Ancient Chinese music, art and many quotes from Confucius enrich the simple narrative.
